children.value: Transform Feedback operations represent a GPGPU/GPU compute technique where GPU draw calls are configured so that they write some specified outputs from the vertex shaders to (one or more) GPU memory buffers that have been provided by the application. Applications use transform feedback to data processing from CPU to GPU, where multiple parallel execution units will be used for processing. Data is handled in form of
objects, i.e. data resides in the GPU memory.
Transform Feedback operations write their output into
instances. These buffers can then be directly set as attributes on

Buffers can be read back to the CPU, but this has a high performance penaltyh. Ideally, the application's logic can be designed so that CPU access is not required which avoids expensive CPU and GPU sync.
To run a single transform feedback operation:
variables) declared in the vertex shader's GLSL code, and provide the names of these varyings to the
but automatically turns off the fragment shader stage.
class is preferable if you don't want to deal with setting up
instances, or if intend to run a repeating, double buffered transform feedback loop.
